form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: Petition to Classify Status of Alien Relative for Issuance of Immigrant Visa,, 4-130

full_text: Screened by NARA, 6/1/2023 SLB CHECKED MM. & NATZ'N SERVICE EMBASSY OF THE UNITED STATES Form approved. Budget Bureau No. 43-R401.4. PETITION TO OF AMERICA MEXICO Date filed Fee CLASSIL STATUS OF $1000 FEE PAID No EYEX-70-11-20 LIEN RELATIVE FOR JUL1 1969 migration and Naturalization service ISSUANCE OF IMMI- Mexico, D. F.. Mexico GRANT VISA AM Pate 7/10/69 verified by H 789 PM (Read this form-and 10 If astractions carefully before filling in petition) To THE SECRETARY OF STATE: July 10, 1969 The petition is revalidated: The petition was filed on 201(b) The petition is approved for status under section Remarks: Following documents seen DATE July 31, 1969 DATE & returned to petitioner: OF OF ACTION Pet. birth cert. ACTION Bene. birth DD Charles J Beechie Marriage cert. Pel.4Bend. cert. of DISTRICT DD DISTRICT Div. Decree of Other Mexico, D. F. drz (PETITIONER IS NOT TO WRITE ABOVE THIS LINE) 1. Petition is hereby made to classify the status of the alien beneficiary for issuance of an immigrant visa as: (Check one) Death Certif of Pits former wife Guadalific Jongaley The spouse, child (regardless of age), parent, brother, or sister of a United States citizen. The spouse or unmarried child (regardless of age) of an alien lawfully admitted to the United States for permanent residence. Block I.-Information About Petitioner PERFECTO GONZALEZ 2. Name (First name) (Middle name) (Last name) If you are a married woman, give your maiden name 1 reside in the United States at 2250 NORTH 16 STREET, MILWAUKEE, WISSCONSIN 53205 3. (Apt. No.) (Number and street) (Town or Colonia (State) (ZIP Code) Address abroad (if any) AVE, VASCO DE QUIROGA # 1706, SANTA FE, MEXICO 18, D. F. (Number and street) (City or town) (Province) (Country) 4. I was born APRIL 9, 1903; EAGLE PASS, TEXAS U. S, A. (Date) (City or town) (State or Province) (Country) 5. If you are a citizen of the United States, give the following: a. Was your citizenship acquired through birth in the United States, through naturalization, through parentage, or through marriage BIRTH (1) If acquired through naturalization, give name under which naturalized, number of naturalization certificate and date and place of naturalization: (2) If acquired through parentage or marriage, have you obtained a certificate of citizenship in your own name based on such acquisition? (a) If so, give number of certificate and date and place of issuance: EMBASSY OF THE UNITED STATES (b) If not, submit evidence of citizenship in accordance with Instruction 3a(2 OF AMERICA b. Have you or any person through whom you claim citizenship ever lost United States citizanship 11969 If so, attach detailed explanation on separate sheet. 6. If you are a lawful permanent resident alien of the United States, give the following: MEXICO D. F. a. Alien Registration Number: A- b. Date, place, and means of admission for lawful permanent residence C. Have you ever lost status as a lawful permanent resident alien? If so, explain: (If you are married to a citizen of the United States, read instruction 1b carefully) Form I-130 (Rev. 5-27-68) UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE-Immigration and Naturalization Service
